intro: Gonzalea petesia, commonly known as the Mexican fireplant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Gonzalea petesia is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
